SEARCH
Package com.example.aurora

Class EventDetailsActivityInstrumentedTest

java.lang.Object
com.example.aurora.EventDetailsActivityInstrumentedTest
public class EventDetailsActivityInstrumentedTest extends Object
UI tests for EventDetailsActivity that work with the real behaviour: - bindEvent(...) calls finish() when the event doc does NOT exist. We avoid that branch by seeding a dummy event in Firestore before launching.

    • testCriteriaDialogShowsGotItButton

      public void testCriteriaDialogShowsGotItButton() throws Exception
      Verifies that the criteria dialog for an event is wired correctly.

      The test launches EventDetailsActivity, taps the "Criteria" button, and asserts that the dialog containing the btnGotIt button is displayed. This confirms that entrants can access the lottery criteria / guidelines from the event details screen.

      Throws:
      Exception

    • testSignUpVisibleForAcceptedEntrantAndClickable

      public void testSignUpVisibleForAcceptedEntrantAndClickable() throws Exception
      Ensures that an entrant who has been accepted for an event can see and use the "Sign Up" button on the event details screen.

      This test seeds Firestore with an event document where the test user's email appears in acceptedEntrants, configures the shared preferences to log in as that entrant, then launches EventDetailsActivity for the seeded event. It asserts that btnSignUp is visible and can be clicked without errors, validating the core sign-up flow for selected entrants.

      Throws:
      Exception
